faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en:
The following topics will be covered:
1. Methods of proteomics: 
Separation of complex protein mixtures by 2D electrophoresis and HPLC. Identification of proteins by mass spectrometry (the principles of mass spectrometry; ionization mechanisms; principles for determination of mass; ion traps; identification  of peptides and proteins; de novo sequencing). Identification of protein modifications. 
2. Bioinformatics methods: 
Database searches for protein identification using mass spectrometry information. Algorithms for comparison of proteomes. Modeling of regulatory networks.
3. Applications of proteomics:
Experimental approaches and modeling for elucidating the kinase networks regulating eukaryotic cell cycle.
description.et:
Kursuses käsitletakse järgnevat temaatikat:
1.Proteoomika laborimeetodid: 
Komplektsete valgusegude lahutamine 2D elektroforeesi ja HPLC abil. Valkude identifitseerimine mass spektromeetria abil (mass spektromeetria tööpõhimõte; erinevad ionisatsiooniliigid; massi määramise viisid; ioonlõksud, valkude ja peptiidide identifitseerimine; de novo sekveneerimine). Valgumodifikatsioonide määramine. 
2. Bioinformaatilised meetodid: 
Andmebaasiotsingud valkude identifitseerimiseks, kasutades mass spektromeetria andmeid. Proteoomide võrdlemise algoritmid. Regulatoorsete võrgustike modelleerimine. 
3. Näiteid proteoomika rakendustest: 
Rakutsüklit reguleerivate kinaasivõrgustike modelleerimine ja eksperimentaalne tuvastamine.

objectives.en: Introducing the basic principles and applications of proteomics

learning_outcomes.en: Student who passes the course will
learning_outcomes.et: Student who passes the course will

learning_outcomes.en: --1-- know the basics of protein structure, folding, expression and the related terminology;
learning_outcomes.et: --1-- know the basics of protein structure, folding, expression and the related terminology;

learning_outcomes.en: --2-- know the main experimental methods used in proteomics, both bottom up and top-down;
learning_outcomes.et: --2-- know the main experimental methods used in proteomics, both bottom up and top-down;

learning_outcomes.en: --3-- know the main data analysis approaches used in proteomics;
learning_outcomes.et: --3-- know the main data analysis approaches used in proteomics;

learning_outcomes.en: --4-- be able to choose an appropriate method for proteomic analysis and the related data treatment.
learning_outcomes.et: --4-- be able to choose an appropriate method for proteomic analysis and the related data treatment.

grade_preconditions.et: To pass the subject one needs to attend at least lectures and pass a written exam.
